thread.title: Please don’t lollygag back to first when Yadier Molina is catching
thread.title_full: Please don’t lollygag back to first when Yadier Molina is catching

author: Grant Brisbee
title: Please don’t lollygag back to first when Yadier Molina is catching
text:
Maybe Jurickson Profar has never heard of Yadier Molina, idk.
The World Baseball Classic has been a lot of fun this year, in part because of the emotions that the players have displayed. Wladimir Balentien treated us to a delightful bat spin on Monday night, and it matched the excitement of the home run perfectly. It turns out that celebrating and exhorting your teammates can be a fine thing. 
Most of the time. 
Yadier Molina can do it all! #WBC2017 
A post shared by WorldBaseballClassic (@wbcbaseball) on Mar 20, 2017 at 6:53pm PDT 
I’ve watched it nine times, and each time it feels like one of those dreams where you can’t run even though your brain is screaming at you. RUN, JURICKSON PROFAR. RUN. OR, I DON’T KNOW, JUST WALK A LITTLE BIT FASTER. 
What have we learned? No lollygagging. Specifically, no lollygagging when Yadier Molina is the catcher. 
Let this be a lesson to all of you young lollygaggers out there.
